post.summary: Uploads a file to your endpoint cloud service. If the destination path includes directories that do not exist, they will be created.

400.description: Bad Request - Often due to a missing request parameter

401.description: Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or org secret provided

403.description: Forbidden - Access to the resource by the provider is forbidden

404.description: Not found - The requested resource is not found

405.description: Method not allowed - Incorrect HTTP verb used, e.g., GET used when POST expected

406.description: Not acceptable - The response content type does not match the 'Accept' header value

409.description: Conflict - If a resource being created already exists

415.description: Unsupported media type - The server cannot handle the requested Content-Type

500.description: Server error - Something went wrong on the Cloud Elements server

502.description: Provider server error - Something went wrong on the Provider or Endpoint's server

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The full path to the file (e.g. /myDirectory/myFile.txt). If folderId is also given, then path will be ignored and the file will be saved in the folder pointing to the given folderId.

parameters.name: calculateFolderPath
parameters.description: Whether or not to construct the path for each item in the response. Defaults to true, when set to false folderId is required

parameters.name: overwrite
parameters.description: Overwrite the file if the file exists

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Description of the file

parameters.name: tags[]
parameters.description: Tags associated with the file

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size of the file in bytes (required only for SharePoint)

parameters.name: mimeType
parameters.description: The mimeType of the file. (e.g. text/plain).

parameters.name: folderId
parameters.description: The folder id is where the file should be uploaded to, this is required when calculateFolderPath is set to false. If calculateFolderPath is set to true and folderId is provided, then the folderId will be ignored. folderId is of higher priority, so if the path parameter is also provided, then it will be ignored.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: The file to be uploaded

parameters.name: thumbnail
parameters.description: The thumbnail for the file to be set

get.summary: Retrieves a single file from your cloud service from a specified path. The file is directly streamed from the cloud storage provider through Cloud Elements, and is not buffered to disk.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The full path to the file (e.g. /myDirectory/myFile.txt)

parameters.name: mediaType
parameters.description: Optional mediaType as defined by the google sdk to send for conversion for google docs. By default Documents are converted to MS Word, Presentation are converted to MS Powerpoint, and SpreadSheets are converted to MS Excel. You can override this default behavior by supplying your own conversion.

parameters.name: teamDriveId
parameters.description: The teamdrive ID. This ID is required if contents need to be listed from a specific teamdrive

parameters.name: includeTeamDrives
parameters.description: Whether Team Drive items should be included in results. Defaults to false

patch.summary: Update a file's metadata (tags and path) associated with a path.  For example, if you had a document that was tagged as operations but needed to be tagged as legal, then you would perform a PATCH to update the tag using the tags JSON array field. patch.summary: Update a folder's metadata (path) associated with an ID.  For example, if you had the ID of a folder that was located in the operations directory, but needed to be moved into the legal directory, then you would perform a PATCH using the path JSON field to update the path.  The PATCH method can update the name or directory of a folder also by using the path JSON field. You cannot update the size of a folder.

parameters.description: Any tags associated with the files (not applicable to folders)

parameters.description: The end date (based on the created date of the file or folder) if used, start date is required

parameters.description: The start date (based on the created date of the file or folder) if used, end date is required

parameters.name: calculateFolderPath
parameters.description: Calculate the folder path. By default, the Google Drive API does not support folder paths. The default value of this flag is 'true', if false, it will only search the root directory. Note: The Google Drive API may timeout if the provided search text is not specific enough.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Defines the order of the data using following keys createdDate, modifiedDate, name. (Default value of createdDate desc). For instance createdDate asc / name asc, createdDate desc

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Text in the file or folder name

parameters.description: The full path to the folder to start searching from (e.g. /myDirectory)
